Commentary: shapes away but from the fifth stump, wide called

Commentary: good leave to a length ball that nips away from outside off

Commentary: hint of a lifter from length outside off, Imam leaves again

Commentary: corker! Squares him up with the length, nips away to miss the outside edge by a whisker
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: slips out to turn into a waist-high full toss, Imam wasn't quite expecting that and just dabs it gently
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: shapes away to beat Imam's poke, a very polite appeal but not out
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: goes full and straight from wide of the crease, Imam looks to play an on-drive but ends up getting a thick inside-edge onto the pad. Excellent first over
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: driven down the ground, mid-off runs back to pull it back just before it crosses the ropes. Excellent running
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, 3 runs

Commentary: gets half-forward and bunts this to mid-off for a quick single
Commentary_short: Holder to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: slants a length ball across, left alone. Good carry to the keeper
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: shades of Sanath Jayasuriya, wow! Length ball on the pads and he whips this over square leg. Strong bottom hands, timing and placement - impeccable. Super hit. How early did he pick the length? Terrific balance, sweet!
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, SIX runs

Commentary: hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to tuck it around the corner
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: nips one away from the fifth stump, left alone
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: slips this into the pads, flicked one bounce to deep backward square leg
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: width and he slaps this over extra cover. Made a hint of room and just clobbered that full toss disdainfully
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: tucks this into the midwicket region for an easy single
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: stands tall and bunts this gently into the off side
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: gets half-forward and defends to short cover
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: gloves this down leg to the keeper. Cottrell salutes but it isn't a delivery you expect to strike with. Slipped it down leg, Imam looking to help it along but could only feather this.
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Imam-ul-Haq, OUT

Commentary: punches this length delivery to mid-on
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: looks to drive on the up, gets a thickish inside edge to mid-on
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: hits the deck hard, Fakhar gets on top of the bounce and defends back
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: width and he blasts this through the gap between cover and point. Delightfully done. Got on top of the bounce and then let his timing do the rest
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: punched, this time in front of square on the off side. Long chase but pulled back
Commentary_short: Holder to Fakhar Zaman, 3 runs

Commentary: off the mark with an imperious flick, just holds up near the midwicket boundary. As a batsman, you can't ask for a better ball first up.
Commentary_short: Holder to Babar Azam, 3 runs

Commentary: gift of a delivery and he gleefully accepts! Babar is on top of his game already. A full toss and he caresses it to the extra cover boundary. Apologetically done
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, FOUR runs

Commentary: much better length - fuller and just around off, Babar rooted to the crease as he defends
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: full and angled across again, there is an invitation to drive if he likes, but Babar decides to leave
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: full and angled across, there's a hint of away movement this time, left alone once again
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: gets on top of the bounce and whips this towards deep square
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, 2 runs

Commentary: good leave to a length ball slanted across
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: plays inside the line after originally looking to work this from outside off to midwicket. Lovely delivery first up
Commentary_short: Russell to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: bunted back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Russell to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: steers this down to square third man
Commentary_short: Russell to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: uses the width to arch back and help it along to third man. Timed well, straight to Oshane Thomas
Commentary_short: Russell to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: the bouncer gets him! The raw pace of Russell has done the trick. Fakhar picks the length but is surprised by the zip as he shapes to pull this short ball, but is a tad late on the stroke as the ball hits the grille of the helmet and rolls back onto the stumps.
Commentary_short: Russell to Fakhar Zaman, OUT

Commentary: surprised him with a short ball again, this one's bowled at 140kph, Sohail ducks
Commentary_short: Russell to Haris Sohail, no run

Commentary: hit on the stomach! It's all happening. Babar shapes to pull but this one just stopped on him a touch and he was through with the shot
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: hops back and across as he defends
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: bunts this with soft hands to the man coming in from point
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: beaten by one that holds its line. Babar shaped for an expansive drive, no feet movement that time
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: wrists this to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: sliced and four! Too full, too wide and he went after that one. Once it was hit over point, it was headed only one way
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Haris Sohail, FOUR runs

Commentary: short of length outside off, steered to square third man
Commentary_short: Russell to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: short of length on middle and leg, tucked to deep square
Commentary_short: Russell to Haris Sohail, 1 run

Commentary: sways out of the way of this short ball outside off
Commentary_short: Russell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: another short ball, Shai Hope had to time his jump behind the stumps to stop that. Babar got out of the way effortlessly
Commentary_short: Russell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: another short ball, another leave as he drops his wrists
Commentary_short: Russell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: gets away with another short ball at 144kph - what's happening? Babar ducks under this.
Commentary_short: Russell to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: slips this length ball down leg, tucked towards long leg
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Haris Sohail, 2 runs

Commentary: punches this on the up to cover
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Haris Sohail, no run

Commentary: thumped but straight to extra cover again
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Haris Sohail, no run

Commentary: lifter, towards his ribs, he hops across and tucks this towards leg gully
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Haris Sohail, 1 run

Commentary: hops back and turns this incoming short ball to the leg side
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: turns this straight to midwicket. Tight over
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: another short ball to begin! Haris gets across and ducks under it
Commentary_short: Russell to Haris Sohail, no run

Commentary: ducks under this short ball on middle. At the moment, Russell's operating just one way: short-short-short-short
Commentary_short: Russell to Haris Sohail, no run

Commentary: another short ball, this one doesn't bounce as much as Haris expects, avoided. Cranked this one at 146kph
Commentary_short: Russell to Haris Sohail, no run

Commentary: he's got him! Russell, you legend. What a gamechanger he is! After going short-short-short, he zips one across at 145kph, Haris looks to ride the bounce but is very late on the stroke and gets the thinnest of edges to Shai Hope behind the stumps. Pakistan in trouble.
Commentary_short: Russell to Haris Sohail, OUT
Dismissal_text: Haris Sohail c †Hope b Russell 8 (17m 11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 72.72

Commentary: right into the blockhole, somehow managed to bring his bat down in the nick of time to keep it out
Commentary_short: Russell to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: length ball, steered straight to point
Commentary_short: Russell to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: beaten on the flick, nipping into him from a length on the stumps and strikes him high on the thigh pad
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: good length outside off, steered towards gully
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: dropped by Hetmyer on point. Dug this in short and outside off, he had a slash at it, went to Hetmyer's immediate left. Easy enough catch, but pops in, and out.
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, worked away with his wrists to square leg
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: goes short again, and the batsman ducks underneath
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: tickled fine and he'll get a boundary for that. Nipping in off the seam but the line is wrong, ends up on the pads and he's able to help it down to fine leg
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, FOUR runs

Commentary: good length on off, tries to drive without moving his feet, inside half of the bat back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Thomas to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: nicely played, short ball but not very quick at 135 kph and he rocks back pull this with good timing to square leg. The fielder runs to his left and dives to save
Commentary_short: Thomas to Babar Azam, 2 runs

Commentary: another short ball and this one is hit even better, pulled in front of square powerfully
Commentary_short: Thomas to Babar Azam, FOUR runs

Commentary: back of a length outside off this time, nicely cut to deep point
Commentary_short: Thomas to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: pacier delivery, length ball outside off, hangs his bat a bit but squirts it down to third man
Commentary_short: Thomas to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: better short ball, outside off and he sways out of the way
Commentary_short: Thomas to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: fuller outside off, he takes a big stride out and punches it to mid-off
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: good length outside off, jabbed to third man from the crease
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: good length around the fourth stump, steered to point
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: back of a length but straying on the pads, he swivels to pull. Doesn't quite get the timing or the placement, and it trickles down to fine leg
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: short ball again, outside off and moving in, he ducks under it
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, no run

Commentary: length ball on the pads, turned wristily to deep square
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Babar Azam, 1 run

Commentary: brilliant catch by Shai Hope He's sprouted wings and flown to his right - and I mean flown because he was airborne and parallel to the ground - to pull off a stunner. That earlier drop isn't going to cost West Indies much after all. Outswinger that was going away from him, Babar had a somewhat lazy waft at it and took a thick edge. Should have ordinarily gone between keeper and slip, or been parried to the ground. Until Hope took off.
Commentary_short: Thomas to Babar Azam, OUT
Dismissal_text: Babar Azam c †Hope b Thomas 22 (47m 33b 2x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

Commentary: greeted with a yorker first up, and he pats it back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: lovely. Pressure? What Pressure? Hafeez gets a short ball outside off so he just goes on his toes and on his back foot to cut it magnificently to the point boundary
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, FOUR runs

Commentary: bad ball, and put away in style! Straying on the pads, too full, and Hafeez plays the pick-up flick to perfection to send this to the deep midwicket fence. A despairing dive by the deep square leg running around is in vain
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball on the pads again, but he misses out that time and doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: fuller on the fifth stump line, he comes on the front foot to meet it and drives it to cover
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: length ball outside off, steered to point
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: goes a bit wider of the crease to angle this in on a length around off, punched back to the bowler from the crease
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, no run

Commentary: digs it in short, but Brathwaite doesn't have the pace of the other West Indies bowlers and the batsman has to wait for the ball and manufacture pace on the pull shot to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Sarfaraz Ahmed, 1 run

Commentary: he's going wide of the crease again, and sticking to the short-pitch strategy. Hafeez lets it go and has a wry smile on his face. That's because this went well over his shoulder and should have perhaps been wide
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: short ball again, he swivels to pull this down to fine leg, who collects on the bounce. Got a thick top edge on that, but no real pace in the shot or the ball, so it doesn't carry.
Commentary_short: Brathwaite to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 run

Commentary: good line and length, in the corridor outside off and he lets it go through
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: fuller length but tailing on the pads. He wanted to flick it away but slightly late on it and it hits his pad to roll back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: fuller length on the fifth stump line, he comes on the front foot to drive, opens the bat face and times it well, but it's straight to point
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: straying in line again, ends up fullish on the pads, but Hafeez's gentle tap can't go past the in field
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: another short ball, but that bounces well above the batsman outside off, and the umpire calls it wide. Fairly flew after pitching
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 wide

Commentary: fuller on off stump, comes forward to check-drive it, mid-off dives and gets a hand to it, so it stops the boundary
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, 2 runs

Commentary: full toss on off, punched from the crease but straight to extra cover
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: Review for caught behind Holder strayed on the legstump with a back of a length ball angling into the batsman, and he doesn't get enough on it to tickle it fine. Shai Hope immediately asked for a review though the umpire thought it had come off the thigh pad, saying he heard two noises. And Hope is right. He got a faint tickle on it, and then it went to the keeper off thigh pad. Captain gets captain, and Pakistan are sinking.
Commentary_short: Holder to Sarfaraz Ahmed, OUT
Dismissal_text: Sarfaraz Ahmed c †Hope b Holder 8 (34m 12b 1x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

Commentary: angling across him from back of a length, he stays in his crease and punches towards extra cover
Commentary_short: Holder to Imad Wasim, no run

Commentary: back of a length on the stumps, he goes back and tucks it to square leg
Commentary_short: Holder to Imad Wasim, 1 run

Commentary: length ball outside off, pushed to cover
Commentary_short: Holder to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: length ball moving in, but ends up on the pads and he's able to flick it to fine leg
Commentary_short: Holder to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 run

Commentary: Gayle's caught it! The West Indians have come out with a simple, yet brutally effective plan, and Pakistan are falling to it. Short, short, short - wicket. This was another short one, Imad tried to pull it, got a top edge that swirled to Gayle's right at slip, and he stretched out to pluck it with one hand.
Commentary_short: Holder to Imad Wasim, OUT
Dismissal_text: Imad Wasim c Gayle b Holder 1 (6m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

Commentary: good length outside off, he comes on the front foot to drive to extra cover
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: fuller on middle and leg, he jabs it down to deep square
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 run

Commentary: nailed in front. Good length, slightly on the fuller side, pitches on middle and beats him with pace. He was playing down the wrong line, and he's caught on the crease with the ball thudding into pad. Oshane goes up, and so does the umpire's finger
Commentary_short: Thomas to Shadab Khan, OUT
Dismissal_text: Shadab Khan lbw b Thomas 0 (3m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: full on off, steered to point
Commentary_short: Thomas to Hasan Ali, no run

Commentary: ooh that's gotta hurt. Back of a length and Hasan is ducking into it while trying to swat it away with his bat, using the bat more to protect himself than to score runs, with eyes off the ball. It hits him on the glove and rolls to square leg
Commentary_short: Thomas to Hasan Ali, 1 run

Commentary: worked to deep square
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on the pads, he gets inside the line and tickles it to fine leg
Commentary_short: Holder to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 run

Commentary: Beaten. Back of a length in the corridor and moving in, sneaks past the outside edge
Commentary_short: Holder to Hasan Ali, no run

Commentary: soft, soft dismissal and again it's to a ball that's shorter than a good length. This was not a bouncer, but back of a length outside off. Hasan thought he'd have a thrash at it and went for the pull, but the problem is, he's not a top order batsman and was late on it. The ball takes the toe-end to swirl comfortably to Cottrell at mid-off for the simplest of catches
Commentary_short: Holder to Hasan Ali, OUT
Dismissal_text: Hasan Ali c Cottrell b Holder 1 (6m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00

Commentary: good length on off, defended off the front foot
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, rising up to chest high, he stays beside the ball and squirts it to third man
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, 1 run

Commentary: fuller on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket to keep strike
Commentary_short: Holder to Mohammad Hafeez, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on middle and leg, nudged to mid-on
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: back of a length
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, no run

Commentary: if it's a short ball, it's going to be wicket! On target bouncer has Hafeez taking ungainly evasive action while trying to duck/sway out of the way. But his bat is left hanging in the air, and the ball pings off to fly to fine leg, where Cottrell dives forward to take a smart catch
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Hafeez, OUT
Dismissal_text: Mohammad Hafeez c Cottrell b Thomas 16 (36m 24b 2x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

Commentary: length on the pads and tucked to square leg, but he has overstepped. So it's a free hit. And that's a BIG over-step. Almost as big as another bowler involved in this match bowled in this country, some nine years back...
Commentary_short: Thomas to Wahab Riaz, 1 no ball

Commentary: backing away to have a swat at it. Another short ball directed in the line of the stumps, and he swings and misses
Commentary_short: Thomas to Wahab Riaz, no run

Commentary: back of a length but straying on leg, and he's flicked off his hips to fine leg
Commentary_short: Thomas to Wahab Riaz, 1 run

Commentary: another short ball, fended down to square leg off his chest
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Amir, 1 run

Commentary: short of length on middle and leg, defended
Commentary_short: Holder to Mohammad Amir, 1 run

Commentary: clobbered over deep midwicket. Banged in short, looked like Wahab had already made up his mind. Super hit
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, SIX runs

Commentary: big swing down the ground, beaten. Backed away to get underneath this yorker-length delivery, swung through early.
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, no run

Commentary: lifter outside off, fended into the off side
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, no run

Commentary: backs away and swings this one over the infield, trickles to the cover boundary. Useful runs. Just cleared his front leg and gave that a good whack
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, FOUR runs

Commentary: this has gone a long, long way into the stands at deep square. Backed away, Holder followed him but it didn't matter. Wahab muscled that away. Incredible strike and the Pakistani fans in the crowd have something to cheer, finally.
Commentary_short: Holder to Wahab Riaz, SIX runs

Commentary: backs away to carve this behind point, misses this yorker-length delivery
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Amir, no run

Commentary: fended towards point. Excellent short ball from Oshane
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Amir, no run

Commentary: backs away to slap this over cover, beaten. But he'll get a no-ball and a free-hit to make amends. Replays confirm this was a horrendous no-ball call from the umpire.
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Amir, 1 no ball

Commentary: walks across and works this down to a hobbling Russell at long leg
Commentary_short: Thomas to Mohammad Amir, 1 run

Commentary: full, straight and gone! Such poor application. Why would you expose all three stumps and slog wildly when you have a lifetime of overs remaining?
Commentary_short: Thomas to Wahab Riaz, OUT

Commentary: good length angling into him and moves a touch away, Gayle jabs it back from his crease
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, no run

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, nudged gently towards midwicket. The fielder is hanging back so they take a quick single
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, he shuffles across to flick, but can't go past square leg
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: fuller on off, driven to mid-off coming on the front foot
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: going across him, and ends up well wide of off, he has a thrash at it, but doesn't time it well and slaps to mid-off
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: straying on leg and picked off the pads to fine leg
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, 1 run

Commentary: very full angling into him, clipped to wide mid-on
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hope, no run

Commentary: misses his line, too far down leg and he'll have to rebowl that. Fortunate perhaps that Hope didn't connect, and tickle it fine for a boundary
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hope, 1 wide

Commentary: length ball outside off, steered to a squarish third man
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hope, 1 run

Commentary: low full toss, intended yorker, pacy one at 143 kph, Gayle gets his bat down and jabs it to mid-off
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, no run

Commentary: top edge goes over the keeper. 140 kph bouncer got big on him, Gayle was looking to use his power to pull it, but gets a top edge. Lands in the safest of places though, right over the wicketkeeper, where no fielder stays
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: slashed hard and that was more intentional. Given width outside off, too full and he has the room to swing his arms, carves it to the third man boundary
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: loud shout but that was probably going down leg. Hasan and the whole team were appealing frantically, but you're not going to get those. Pitched on leg and was moving in, Gayle missed the flick, but the ball would have missed the stumps. Pitched well outside leg actually
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, no run

Commentary: stand and delivery by Hope. Short and wide outside off, he stands tall and slaps this through cover. Hafeez gives chase and slides to pull the ball back in
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, 2 runs

Commentary: length outside off, defended to point
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: back of a length, angling across him, he punches to mid-off
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: goes for the pull off a short ball, but doesn't time it. Top edge but it flies well above the in-field and lands in the midwicket area.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, 2 runs

Commentary: leading edge now, pops up in the air but well to the bowler's right and well short of mid-on. Hope's had a few uncertain moments. This was a length ball that held it's line and Hope was playing inside it, trying to flick
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: swing and a miss. Back of a length, angling across him, he stays in his crease and tries to cut it, but the ball goes over the bat. Half-hearted appeal
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: clears his front leg, gives himself room and plays the pick-up shot to send this over cow corner - but he's not timed it and gets more height than distance. No fielder there though, so it plonks safely onto the grass
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, 2 runs

Commentary: boom, Chris Gayle is in the house. Too full and Gayle nails the pickup that time, smashes it over long-on. Was the slower ball, off-cutter perhaps. But Gayle read it
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, SIX runs

Commentary: smashed, but without timing. And it still manages to clear the straight boundary. Another full ball, Gayle clears his leg again and thrashes it with a full swing of his arms, doesn't time it at all, almost slices it. Still gets maximum
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, SIX runs

Commentary: He's just looking to take the attack to the bowler now, but Hasan bowled that well enough. Followed him as he was walking across and Gayle hoicks it to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, 1 run

Commentary: bouncer on target, and Hope ducks under it
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hope, no run

Commentary: another short ball, this time he rocks back and pulls it hard, from in front of his face down to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hope, 1 run

Commentary: take that. On the front foot and slap-drives it through extra cover for a boundary. This was angling across him and on the shorter side, gave him room and width to smash it
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, FOUR runs

Commentary: late on it, stays rooted to the crease and manages to drop this length ball down near his toes at the last moment.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, no run

Commentary: slices it high in the air and is taken. Hope hasn't looked very fluent in this innings, despite a couple of crisp shots. He wanted to go over the top again, but sends it swirling to mid-off's left. Hafeez sprints and tumbles to complete the catch
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hope, OUT
Dismissal_text: SD Hope c Mohammad Hafeez b Mohammad Amir 11 (21m 17b 1x4 0x6) SR: 64.70

Commentary: full on the toes, clipped to square leg
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, 1 run

Commentary: short ball, an dhe ducks under it. Too short though and too high above the batsman, so it's a wide
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Bravo, 1 wide

Commentary: back of a length outside off, drops it down towards point from his crease
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Bravo, no run
Mohammad Amir to Bravo, no run

Commentary: full toss,  high full toss on off stump, punched to extra cover
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, no run

Commentary: too close to cut, but tell that to Gayle! slashed from very close to his body, but gets enough on it to send it to the third man boundary. Third man was in the circle and it flew over the infield
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower yorker on leg stump, clipped to mid-on
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, no run

Commentary: another slightly slower one at 124 kph, Gayle was backing away to smash it through off, but ends up defending it tentatively back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, no run

Commentary: keeping to the 125kph pace region, back of a length and jagging away from Gayle, squares him up and gets the edge, but soft hands mean it bounces well in front of slip
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, no run

Commentary: dismissed from his presence. Short ball at normal pace, Gayle rocks back and unleashes a fierce pull. Thwack into the boundary boards
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: back of a length outside off, defended towards point
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Bravo, no run

Commentary: caught at second slip. Off-cutter, pitches back of a length outside off and seemed to hold on the pitch a bit, and bounce more than Bravo expected. He ends up fending it from his crease, takes the shoulder of the bat and second slip holds on to his right at shoulder height.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Bravo, OUT
Dismissal_text: DM Bravo c Babar Azam b Mohammad Amir 0 (10m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: fuller on the stumps, twirled to fine leg with his wrists
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on off, jabbed to point, bringing his bat down a tad late
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, no run

Commentary: length ball, moving in, but ends up on the pads and rolls to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, 1 leg bye

Commentary: good length, nipping into him, he gets caught in a bit of a tangle but pushes it back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, no run

Commentary: good length on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler's left
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, no run

Commentary: length ball on the pads, tries to flick it, but it only rolls to the keeper off the pad
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, no run

Commentary: well directed short ball on the fourth stump line, Gayle sways out of the way in time
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, no run

Commentary: swing and a miss. Short outside off, Gayle wanted to send this to downtown Bristol with a fierce pull, but doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, no run

Commentary: high full toss, Gayle is surprised by it and ends up patting it back to the bowler. Looks to square leg, but the umpire doesn't think that was a no-ball
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, no run

Commentary: well directed bouncer. Pacy and very on target, would have taken off Gayle's head, but he arched his back to get out of the way
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, no run

Commentary: length on the pads, clipped to fine leg
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, 1 leg bye

Commentary: back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, 1 run
Mohammad Amir to Pooran, no run

Commentary: short ball outside off, he fetches the pull all the way from a seventh stump line and sends it to the deep midwicket boundary
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, FOUR runs

Commentary: draws a thick edge with a length ball outside off, moving away a touch, but it rolls down safely to third man
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length outside off again, Gayle stands tall and punches to mid-off's right
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, 1 run

Commentary: slapped over mid-off and into the boundary. Too short and sat up to be hit, Gayle cleared his leg and thwacked it hard
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, SIX runs

Commentary: shot!. Coming into him from back of a length and cramps him for room even as he was moving away but he manages to cut it powerfully over cover-point
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: boom too short and pulled disdainfully to deep square leg for another boundary
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: too full, ends up as a full toss on the pads. He misses his flick and they take a leg-bye. But Gayle is holding his back as he limps across to the other end. Trouble? Hopefully nothing serious
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Gayle, 1 leg bye

Commentary: length ball outside off, Pooran plays inside the line and ends up feeling for it as it whistles past his outside edge
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, no run

Commentary: moving away off a length and it beats his outside edge again. Pooran wanted to prod it away.
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, no run

Commentary: banged in short, Gayle ducks under this
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, no run

Commentary: there's a 33-ball half-century with a gentle nudge down to fine leg. He's cringing a little with that recurring back issue, but he's played really well.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, 1 run

Commentary: jeez! What power. He's given it a proper wallop. On the up to the extra cover fence. Tracer bullet stuff
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, FOUR runs

Commentary: squared up by the length but he gets some bat to this, runs down to third man where Wahab throws himself to stop it
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Pooran, 1 run

Commentary: point takes a dolly, Gayle was increasingly looking edgy with that back issue. Takes a swipe at this length ball, gets a top-edge and that's an easy catch. He's done his job though.
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Gayle, OUT
Dismissal_text: CH Gayle c Shadab Khan b Mohammad Amir 50 (51m 34b 6x4 3x6) SR: 147.05

Commentary: nice and full on the stumps, defended
Commentary_short: Mohammad Amir to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: skiddy short ball, pulled to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, 1 run

Commentary: put down at deep square! Full marks for the effort though. The plan was right. Short at good pace, outside off, above his shoulders, getting him to fetch the pull from way outside off. No control for Hetmyer but he survives. Possible that Imam may have just reacted a split-second late. Lucky escape
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Hetmyer, 1 run

Commentary: fends this lifter to get a thick outside edge that flies over the slip cordon to the third man boundary
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, FOUR runs

Commentary: flat-batted disdainfully over mid-on! Did he just look in some sort of discomfort earlier? Woah, no traces of that with this one. Thumped. Special, absolutely special
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, SIX runs

Commentary: bounces away from Hafeez running around at fine leg, another top-edge to an ill-advised pull. Gets away
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, 2 runs

Commentary: bunts this to Shadab at point
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, no run

Commentary: back of length on middle and leg, he tucks this behind square and they scamper back for the second. Imad had to run across a long way, from deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hetmyer, 2 runs

Commentary: sways out of the way of this short ball easily
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: defends this incoming length ball with soft hands
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: goes full, he flicks this from outside off to deep backward square leg
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hetmyer, 2 runs

Commentary: mistimed pull, down to deep square leg again
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Hetmyer, 1 run

Commentary: squared up by the length, but he somehow manages to negotiate this with soft hands
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Pooran, no run

Commentary: shapes to pull so he bangs this in a lot wider, and the umpire puts his arms out to call it a wide
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Hetmyer, 1 wide

Commentary: looks to back away and flick but gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Hetmyer, 1 run

Commentary: backs away to slap that, but gets a thick outside edge, one bounce to the third man boundary. Not where he wanted but he'll take the runs and West Indies are one blow away from a convincing win.
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, FOUR runs

Commentary: beaten as he's way too early into this pull off a slower delivery
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, no run

Commentary: that's the end of that, and it's a monstrous hit to finish it! Backed away, the bowler followed him but he still managed to hold his shape and muscle this pull to clear deep midwicket. As convincing as victories get, don't think West Indies would've even dreamt of a victory margin of this sorts. Lot of soul-searching for Pakistan, but the format gives them some leeway
Commentary_short: Wahab Riaz to Pooran, SIX runs
